ooC: This 'short' post, as you put it, is far longer than 80% of the 
posts in the RPG. =P

-- Pacifix / Crossroads --

Pacifix shakes his head after Crotale leaves into the base. "I have 
to choose who to trust, and I have chosen to trust you. So far I 
haven't messed up big time and I'd like to keep it that way. Anyway 
I trust Hoist's advice, so when he puts his energon on trusting 
someone, I'll trust that someone. Someone being you in this case."

He gestures for Skullhammer to enter the base, "Come on in and meet 
the rest of the crew. Then we'll talk." He enters the base.

Crossroads is just inside the base, and almost runs into 
Pacifix. "What's up with Crotale? He was shaking his head as he 
walked by me." 

Crossroads glances behind Pacifix, and looks up to spot 
Skullhammer. "Hello there, I'm Crossroads. You're rather big!" The 
minibot is dwarfed by the massive bot.

ooC: btw, I can't believe I messed up that they're/their thingy in 
the ooc of my last post. *shudders* =P


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "polar_claw_ca" <dfinnamore@h...> wrote:
> (OOC) Apologies in advance for the short post, I haven't got much 
> time today. I might be able to supplement this afterwards, but 
that's 
> iffy. I'll post twice tomorrow to make up, yes? And what a 
> coincidence, I have a character INCREDIBLY similar to Crotale 
> starring in my fanfiction that I am currently working on. 'Cept 
he's 
> an Apache helicopter (or soon will be). By the way, dun take this 
> personally, it's just Skull's way of looking at things.
> 
> (IC)
> Watching the Autobot whose inferiority complex rivals many massive 
> quadrupeds of prehistoric earth in size, an aloof and confident 
> Skullhammer lets it slide. The big bot is older and more 
experienced 
> than the smug young transformer, and has found that when dealing 
with 
> the meager few Autobots who find suspicion goes father than trust, 
to 
> simply ignore any of the comments they might make.
> 
> "Yeah, yeah. And Optimus Prime's predecessor was a toaster oven. 
If I 
> was one of the Preds or Decepticons, would I bother showing up 
> without my guns blazing? I know full well our procedures for 
landing 
> parties that come unannounced." The muttered words, loud enough to 
be 
> heard but quiet enough to not be taken as a threat, were stronger 
> than Skullhammer meant to bring on all at once. With a distant 
> shaking of his head, Skullhammer looks towards the form of Pacifix 
> and waits for further orders.
